intro: Pseudodictamnus rotundifolius, commonly known as the round-leaved pseudodictamnus, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with cool temperatures. Its leaves are rounded and densely arranged, while its small white or pink flowers bloom in umbrella-like clusters. Pseudodictamnus rotundifolius is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
